Job Description:
Your work makes the difference between a user seeing a bus drive away or reaching it just in time. We feel a great sense of responsibility at Citymapper. Millions of users around the world trust our green app to be on time for work, a job interview or a date.
As one of our Data Analysts you will build the timetable data that powers the Citymapper app and help launch new cities. Working with our engineers to improve tools and automate tasks, you'll manage data in a range of cities across different formats.
This role is designed for contractors based in Malaysia.

The Research Analyst at SEDAR Institute is responsible for the research on political ideas and analysis of government policies, political trends and related issues. The research analyst should be able to study the development of political systems, research various political subjects, collect and analyze data. Requirements: - Demonstrate interest in politics. - Preferably with University degree in Politics, Social Science, Foreign Affairs, History, International Relations, Economics, Law or other with related discipline with experience. - Work experience as a research analyst and portfolio of published articles. - Good command of Bahasa Malaysia, English and Chinese. - Strong written and oral communications skills. - Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills. Responsibility: - Work on a range of research projects, including politics, government policies, social, cultures and economic. - Keeping up to date with political sources released by government agencies, including press releases and reports. - Collect data from various sources such as public opinion surveys and election results. - Employ a variety of different research methodologies, including questionnaires, surveys, and interviews. - Use statistical analysis to interpret research findings. - Evaluate the effects of policies and laws on government, businesses and people. - Forecast political, economic and social trends. - Present research results by writing reports, giving presentations and publishing articles. - Monitor current trends and developments, policy decisions and legislation changes. - Establish contacts and sources to use in future research. - Other duties as directed.
SEDAR Institute is a non-profit and independent organisation seeking to develop ideas and strategies to help building a united, democratic, just, egalitarian, liberal and progressive nation for all Malaysians, transcending the barriers of race and religion. Overview of Role The BI & Data Analyst is responsible for the successful delivery, design and support of high visibility desktop reports, mobile reports, and dashboards. As a BI Engineer you will leverage BI applications (including Phocus and Power BI) in accordance with application development standards and best practices. You will work closely with Department heads, SMEs, and Systems engineers from wireframe development to post deployment support. This role will perform data analytics including extracting, restructuring, and cleansing data and assist in solution design efforts including analysis, design and architecture for data and reporting structures. The role will also be responsible for incident management within your area of expertise and providing proper feedback to end-users regarding reporting system status and/or errors. Core Responsibilities translates business needs into technical specifications to deliver customized reporting systems. Accountable for end-to-end development and support of Polyaire’s BI reporting environments for ongoing metrics, reports, dashboards, etc. Creates data visualizations that illustrate data learnings and insights in an understandable and user-friendly manner through UI/UX design. Adopts and adapts to newly approved technologies, programming languages, tools, and standards for business intelligence. Collaborates to ensure application designs utilise appropriate patterns and standards. Creates and refines user manuals for each reporting application/visualisation. Documents BI application specifications and produces operational support manuals. Identifies and interprets trends, patterns, and correlations among various data points. Assesses functional and non-functional requirements and creates designs to meet both business and technical needs. Designs, builds, and maintains automated reporting, dashboards, and analysis to enable teams to self-service data needs. Assists in defining technical requirements such as tool or platform selection criteria for the reporting environments. Assists in solution design efforts (i.e., analysis, data warehouse design, architecture) and understands the data warehouse or data lakes implementation related to BI. Identifies, designs, and implements internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing BI capabilities. Identifies ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality of data management required for building BI applications and reports. Communicates technical concepts to non-technical audiences both in written and verbal form. Engages with other business units and customer environments to extract, restructure, and cleanse data. Skills and Competencies 2+ years’ experience working with BI technologies and tools like Microsoft Power BI, Phocas, Tableau etc. 2+ years’ BI related experience using ETL, Data warehousing management, Data Mining, Report Designer, or development; ability to write complex SQL queries against a variety of data sources. 3+ years’ heterogeneous database management systems experience for example: MS SQL, MySQL etc. and working knowledge with various data sources like flat files (csv, delimited), Web API, XML. Proven ability to build consensus between teams with differing architecture and design viewpoints and perspectives. Good understanding of data and query optimization, query profiling, and query performance monitoring tools and techniques. Experience implementing solutions on multiple platforms. Must be self-motivated, responsible, conscientious, and detail oriented. Proven ability to follow priorities and timelines. Must have strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Able to work in a fast-paced agile development environment. Experience Highly desirables: Microsoft Power BI certifications. Epicor or similar ERP experience Experience delivering reporting design, visualizations, and solutions through agile software development methodologies. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Qualifications BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent software/services experience.

CX Data Analyst
As a Customer Experience (CX) Data Analyst, you will collate information, design reports, and analyse data utilizing business intelligence framework to enable actionable insights for the CX team and stakeholders. You must possess a keen interest in learning and sharing knowledge with the business and regional stakeholders through strong business acumen and insightful conversations. You must have the ability to transform data into critical knowledge that can be used to make sound business decisions. This will include gathering and analyzing information, prioritizing business needs, defining relevant key performance indicators (KPI) and monitoring trends across the sources of intelligence. You must be comfortable in providing leadership in facilitating information gathering and communicating findings to all levels of management.

We are looking for a Data Analyst who will help Vettons to analyse the data to provide solutions related to our business strategies and automate our processes. Your primary focus will be conducting assessments and risk analysis on a regular basis. You will be responsible for preparing complex reports and gathering intelligence data to make informed conclusions on business practices and will be presenting your findings and progress to the key persons from the departments in Vettons. Responsibilities: Compiling and analysing large amounts of data from several sources; Analysing and use conceptual thinking skills with attention to details; Exploring data to solve business problems (taking a large, complex problem and breaking it down into components, involve others as needed, drive resolution); Communicate with business stakeholders as well as development teams; The individual is responsible to evaluate and associate the business KPIs improvement as the result delivered by the predictive models The individual will be responsible for identifying analytics use cases and work with the data engineering and data scientist team to generate the insightful information. The individual will be responsible to communicate with the client and must be able to present the insightful story to the client using the most humanly understandable language and jargon. The individual will need to recommend an action plan based on the data driven insights and perform regular health checks with clients to measure the adoption rate on data analytics projects. The individual will also need to drive statistical analysis projects from beginning to end, and have working experience with regression, factor analysis, building models and predictive analytics. Have a deep understanding of large data, our data structures, and how to manipulate our data in an efficient manner. Requirements & Skills Bachelor Degree in Computer Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, Information Systems or related field. Preferably with experience in multiple BI technology or business domains and experience in BA role would be an asset. A strong knowledge of data analysis with experience. Technical skills (e.g.) around SQL and any of BI technologies (Tableau, SAP BO, Spotfire, etc.); Knowledge of ETL. Understanding business processes and system processes to make recommendations and propose BI solutions. Ability to interact with the business stakeholders and product backlog owners to understand their requirements. Ability to effectively present information to various groups of recipients.

Global Fashion Group (GFG) is the leading fashion and lifestyle retail destination in Asia Pacific, Latin America and CIS. We connect over 10,000 global, local and own brands to a market of more than one billion consumers through four established e-commerce platforms: THE ICONIC, ZALORA, dafiti and lamoda. Through an inspiring and seamless customer experience enabled by our own technology ecosystem and operational infrastructure, we are dedicated to being the #1 fashion and lifestyle destination in our markets. With 17 offices and 10 fulfilment centres across four continents, GFG proudly employs a dynamic and diverse team with deep local knowledge and expertise. In 2019, GFG delivered more than 34 million orders to over 13 million Active Customers.
*
ABOUT THE FUNCTION*
The Data Team is an integral part of GFG team and is essential to enable a data-driven decision making culture. The Data team sits at the cross-roads of various departments ranging from Category Management (Buying & Planning), Finance, Customer Service, Marketing & Fulfilment Centre. It is an exciting place to be and allows us to provide unique insights about the business, its environment and the marketplace.

We are looking for who is happy to play across the data spectrum - of data engineering, data science and eventually a bit of data translation of insights to English.
You should have a demonstrated passion for Data Science in gathering data from various sources, reviewing and interpreting it using data analytics tools to provide meaningful information and insights to help the business to make better-informed decisions.
You will be reporting to the Data Science Manager, and working with various counterparts in Singapore and Vietnam.

Your work will have a direct impact on shaping the future of how all the operations and decisions are enabled across 14 countries around the world, and will help run the group more efficiently and be on the leading edge of offering a seamless customer experience.

Job Description
Job Description Summary

Position Summary: Using your strong Tableau/Power BI visualisation and storytelling skills, you will develop engaging and informative reports that deliver timely and strategic insights to internal and external stakeholders. We are looking for a Data Analyst that has a flair for being creative in the way they present data and insights. So what is your role about? Design and Develop Internal and Client facing dashboards in Tableau or Power BI to deliver key business insights that drive value. Collaborate with business teams to gather and document requirements for reports development and analysis. Coordinate with business stakeholders to identify opportunities for delivering reports that add value by answering key questions to all audiences. Provide guidance to operational teams on the appropriate ways of recording data for effective reporting Support data analysis with intermediate/advance SQL skills to ensure all data is queried in a scalable and optimised manner. Conduct thorough UAT with stakeholders to ensure all data is accurate and consistent across all reports. Promote best practice within the BI Team for the use of Tableau/Power BI published data sources. Participate in Data extraction, cleansing, manipulation, and transformation for the use in reporting and analytics Support the ongoing maintenance of Tableau Server users and schedules. Improve the use of Tableau throughout the organisation by providing skills workshops and user documentation Who are we looking for? 2+ years of experience in data warehousing and business intelligence concepts, including statistical analysis and presentation (e.g., charts, graphs, median, rank, Pareto analysis, etc). 2+ years experience as a business intelligence developer/analyst, with strong experience in Tableau or Power BI Demonstrable intermediate/advanced SQL skills Must have attention to detail and take pride in your work Ability to work as a team player in a fast-paced, critical service delivery environment. Must be a self-starter that can work independently, understand expectations, and demonstrate insatiable curiosity about what the data is telling the organization. Ability to ask and anticipate the next question in discussion with business Strong communication skills to work with multiple disciplines and bridge the gaps between the need for actionable information and technical tools to provide it Understanding of “machine learning” and predictive analytics and their application with Tableau/PowerBI would be an advantage What do we provide to you for you to succeed? Attractive remuneration and package will commensurate with experience and qualification Performance Bonus based on performance record Your Medical Claims Are On Us Training and certification sponsored Rewards and recognition: Employee Of The Quarter Award Work Life Balance Culture: Flexible Working Hours Career advancement Are you ready to elevate your working skills and experience? Job Description
The Performance Management (PMI) team is in charge of developing, executing and managing the right Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and works closely with other functions within LEL to ensure the suitability of these KPIs and identify potential improvement points which can be performed. The PMI team also acts as the Project Management Office (PMO) for Sales Campaign preparation and performance monitoring.

The role will be reporting to the Head of Performance Management & Improvement.

Your Roles and Responsibilities include but not limited to:

Plan and develop CRM activities plan for both B2C and B2B with aim to build loyalty and drive consumption, taking into account International strategy and guidelines.
Leverage on customer insights from data analyses and post evaluations and make recommendations.
Identify customers most at risk of attrition and initiate programs to retain them
Optimization of CRM/marketing activities by defining market sectors and customer selection based on customer profiling and segmentation.
Setup campaigns in system/within the tools (Nessoft/Adobe)
Analyze and interpret data to gain deeper understanding of our customers to develop customer-led insights
Identify key trends and criteria that influence customer behaviour like consumption and loyalty.

About UOB
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.
Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.
About the Department

Get to know our Team:
Everyday, millions of users across Southeast Asia trust and rely on Grab to get them from point A to point B in the safest and most efficient way possible. The Integrity Team acts as guardians of all our users on Grab. As Risk Analysts within Integrity, we leverage our rich datasets to build insight and find solutions to problems ranging from safety to fraud. We're a hands-on team interested in the end to end data life-cycle, from analyzing the risky behavior of our consumers and identifying anomalies to building detection and prevention modules for any suspicious activities. If you're passionate about solving complex problems with immediate real-world impact, we want you!
The day-to-day activities:
Analyze massive passenger, driver, and merchant data to develop insights on user behaviors and/or risks

Job Description
Workforce Budgeting and Planning Analyst

Ensure a robust workforce budgeting plan is in place that meets operational needs and can be delivered within the agreed financial envelope over the period.
You will:
Manage the workforce budgeting planning strategies, processes and interventions that support the Group’s overall operating direction and strategy
Manage the integration of Workforce budgeting planning and Manpower Planning to deliver seamless services to the organization

Preparation of portfolio risk reports on timely and accurate basis for senior management (including Board Risk, Credit Committees and Regulators) and Group office. Ensure timely escalation to the Senior Management on asset quality issues of the portfolios and/or any deviation from the pre-set risk thresholds, triggers and budget to the respective stakeholders
Work closely with stakeholders including Risk partners, Collections, Business partners to identify stress segments or pockets of opportunities to support risk and return strategies
Tracking of new product rollout to monitor the performance and success level of these initiatives.
Support data infrastructure development initiative within the department including data migration, data validation and datamart development.
Involve in Risk Scorecard strategy, monitoring and periodic assessment to ensure effectiveness and predictiveness of the scorecard is still intact

Ensure data consistency across the core business systems (JDE, SFDC, Anaplan, Qlik).

Key Responsibilities:
Provide complex root cause analysis, formulate, and propose alternative solutions and recommendations including providing guidance to stakeholders utilizing data management.
Define business terms and data quality rules while ensuring integrity and consistency.
Analyze data quality issues and provide solutions on data management with high complexity.
Drive the data quality of master data across the domains in assigned region.
Recommend and lead the implementation of continuous data process improvements and/or transformations to existing processes.

Campaign Management function is one of the core pillar of Data & Analytics. The core function of Campaign Management is to manage the marketing campaign execution process, from target base extraction, rollout via multiple channels and tracking of campaign results. The campaign execution process is an integrated process where marketing offers are made via real-time or batch; and communicated via single channel or multiple channels. Currently, campaign management function support the campaign rollout for Cards & Unsecured Lending Business, Retail Banking, Mortgage, and Digital Banking.

Working with our engineers to improve tools and automate tasks, you'll manage data in a range of cities across different formats.
This role is designed for contractors based in Malaysia.

We have 17,800 people operating across 44 countries, and every day we’re investing in new technologies, talented people and innovation to help all our clients maximize every opportunity. We are listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN) and are a constituent of the FTSE 100 Index.

Work you will do

Overview of Role The BI & Data Analyst is responsible for the successful delivery, design and support of high visibility desktop reports, mobile reports, and dashboards. As a BI Engineer you will leverage BI applications (including Phocus and Power BI) in accordance with application development standards and best practices. You will work closely with Department heads, SMEs, and Systems engineers from wireframe development to post deployment support. This role will perform data analytics including extracting, restructuring, and cleansing data and assist in solution design efforts including analysis, design and architecture for data and reporting structures. The role will also be responsible for incident management within your area of expertise and providing proper feedback to end-users regarding reporting system status and/or errors. Core Responsibilities translates business needs into technical specifications to deliver customized reporting systems. Accountable for end-to-end development and support of Polyaire’s BI reporting environments for ongoing metrics, reports, dashboards, etc. Creates data visualizations that illustrate data learnings and insights in an understandable and user-friendly manner through UI/UX design. Adopts and adapts to newly approved technologies, programming languages, tools, and standards for business intelligence. Collaborates to ensure application designs utilise appropriate patterns and standards. Creates and refines user manuals for each reporting application/visualisation. Documents BI application specifications and produces operational support manuals. Identifies and interprets trends, patterns, and correlations among various data points. Assesses functional and non-functional requirements and creates designs to meet both business and technical needs. Designs, builds, and maintains automated reporting, dashboards, and analysis to enable teams to self-service data needs. Assists in defining technical requirements such as tool or platform selection criteria for the reporting environments. Assists in solution design efforts (i.e., analysis, data warehouse design, architecture) and understands the data warehouse or data lakes implementation related to BI. Identifies, designs, and implements internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing BI capabilities. Identifies ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality of data management required for building BI applications and reports. Communicates technical concepts to non-technical audiences both in written and verbal form. Engages with other business units and customer environments to extract, restructure, and cleanse data. Skills and Competencies 2+ years’ experience working with BI technologies and tools like Microsoft Power BI, Phocas, Tableau etc. 2+ years’ BI related experience using ETL, Data warehousing management, Data Mining, Report Designer, or development; ability to write complex SQL queries against a variety of data sources. 3+ years’ heterogeneous database management systems experience for example: MS SQL, MySQL etc. and working knowledge with various data sources like flat files (csv, delimited), Web API, XML. Proven ability to build consensus between teams with differing architecture and design viewpoints and perspectives. Good understanding of data and query optimization, query profiling, and query performance monitoring tools and techniques. Experience implementing solutions on multiple platforms. Must be self-motivated, responsible, conscientious, and detail oriented. Proven ability to follow priorities and timelines. Must have strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Able to work in a fast-paced agile development environment. Experience Highly desirables: Microsoft Power BI certifications. Epicor or similar ERP experience Experience delivering reporting design, visualizations, and solutions through agile software development methodologies. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Qualifications BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent software/services experience.

Designs, builds, and maintains automated reporting, dashboards, and analysis to enable teams to self-service data needs. Assists in defining technical requirements such as tool or platform selection criteria for the reporting environments. Assists in solution design efforts (i.e., analysis, data warehouse design, architecture) and understands the data warehouse or data lakes implementation related to BI. Identifies, designs, and implements internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing BI capabilities. Identifies ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality of data management required for building BI applications and reports. Communicates technical concepts to non-technical audiences both in written and verbal form. Engages with other business units and customer environments to extract, restructure, and cleanse data. Skills and Competencies 2+ years’ experience working with BI technologies and tools like Microsoft Power BI, Phocas, Tableau etc. 2+ years’ BI related experience using ETL, Data warehousing management, Data Mining, Report Designer, or development; ability to write complex SQL queries against a variety of data sources. 3+ years’ heterogeneous database management systems experience for example: MS SQL, MySQL etc. and working knowledge with various data sources like flat files (csv, delimited), Web API, XML. Proven ability to build consensus between teams with differing architecture and design viewpoints and perspectives. Good understanding of data and query optimization, query profiling, and query performance monitoring tools and techniques. Experience implementing solutions on multiple platforms. Must be self-motivated, responsible, conscientious, and detail oriented. Proven ability to follow priorities and timelines. Must have strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Able to work in a fast-paced agile development environment. Experience Highly desirables: Microsoft Power BI certifications. Epicor or similar ERP experience Experience delivering reporting design, visualizations, and solutions through agile software development methodologies. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Qualifications BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent software/services experience.

Overview of Role The BI & Data Analyst is responsible for the successful delivery, design and support of high visibility desktop reports, mobile reports, and dashboards. As a BI Engineer you will leverage BI applications (including Phocus and Power BI) in accordance with application development standards and best practices. You will work closely with Department heads, SMEs, and Systems engineers from wireframe development to post deployment support. This role will perform data analytics including extracting, restructuring, and cleansing data and assist in solution design efforts including analysis, design and architecture for data and reporting structures. The role will also be responsible for incident management within your area of expertise and providing proper feedback to end-users regarding reporting system status and/or errors. Core Responsibilities translates business needs into technical specifications to deliver customized reporting systems. Accountable for end-to-end development and support of Polyaire’s BI reporting environments for ongoing metrics, reports, dashboards, etc. Creates data visualizations that illustrate data learnings and insights in an understandable and user-friendly manner through UI/UX design. Adopts and adapts to newly approved technologies, programming languages, tools, and standards for business intelligence. Collaborates to ensure application designs utilise appropriate patterns and standards. Creates and refines user manuals for each reporting application/visualisation. Documents BI application specifications and produces operational support manuals. Identifies and interprets trends, patterns, and correlations among various data points. Assesses functional and non-functional requirements and creates designs to meet both business and technical needs. Designs, builds, and maintains automated reporting, dashboards, and analysis to enable teams to self-service data needs. Assists in defining technical requirements such as tool or platform selection criteria for the reporting environments. Assists in solution design efforts (i.e., analysis, data warehouse design, architecture) and understands the data warehouse or data lakes implementation related to BI. Identifies, designs, and implements internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing BI capabilities. Identifies ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality of data management required for building BI applications and reports. Communicates technical concepts to non-technical audiences both in written and verbal form. Engages with other business units and customer environments to extract, restructure, and cleanse data. Skills and Competencies 2+ years’ experience working with BI technologies and tools like Microsoft Power BI, Phocas, Tableau etc. 2+ years’ BI related experience using ETL, Data warehousing management, Data Mining, Report Designer, or development; ability to write complex SQL queries against a variety of data sources. 3+ years’ heterogeneous database management systems experience for example: MS SQL, MySQL etc. and working knowledge with various data sources like flat files (csv, delimited), Web API, XML. Proven ability to build consensus between teams with differing architecture and design viewpoints and perspectives. Good understanding of data and query optimization, query profiling, and query performance monitoring tools and techniques. Experience implementing solutions on multiple platforms. Must be self-motivated, responsible, conscientious, and detail oriented. Proven ability to follow priorities and timelines. Must have strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Able to work in a fast-paced agile development environment. Experience Highly desirables: Microsoft Power BI certifications. Epicor or similar ERP experience Experience delivering reporting design, visualizations, and solutions through agile software development methodologies. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Qualifications BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent software/services experience.

Core Responsibilities translates business needs into technical specifications to deliver customized reporting systems. Accountable for end-to-end development and support of Polyaire’s BI reporting environments for ongoing metrics, reports, dashboards, etc. Creates data visualizations that illustrate data learnings and insights in an understandable and user-friendly manner through UI/UX design. Collaborates to ensure application designs utilise appropriate patterns and standards. Creates and refines user manuals for each reporting application/visualisation. Documents BI application specifications and produces operational support manuals. Identifies and interprets trends, patterns, and correlations among various data points. Assists in solution design efforts (i.e., analysis, data warehouse design, architecture) and understands the data warehouse or data lakes implementation related to BI. Communicates technical concepts to non-technical audiences both in written and verbal form. Engages with other business units and customer environments to extract, restructure, and cleanse data. Proven ability to build consensus between teams with differing architecture and design viewpoints and perspectives. Good understanding of data and query optimization, query profiling, and query performance monitoring tools and techniques. Experience implementing solutions on multiple platforms. Must be self-motivated, responsible, conscientious, and detail oriented. Proven ability to follow priorities and timelines. Must have strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Able to work in a fast-paced agile development environment. Experience Highly desirables: Microsoft Power BI certifications. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Qualifications BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent software/services experience.

Overview of Role The BI & Data Analyst is responsible for the successful delivery, design and support of high visibility desktop reports, mobile reports, and dashboards. As a BI Engineer you will leverage BI applications (including Phocus and Power BI) in accordance with application development standards and best practices. You will work closely with Department heads, SMEs, and Systems engineers from wireframe development to post deployment support. This role will perform data analytics including extracting, restructuring, and cleansing data and assist in solution design efforts including analysis, design and architecture for data and reporting structures. The role will also be responsible for incident management within your area of expertise and providing proper feedback to end-users regarding reporting system status and/or errors. Core Responsibilities translates business needs into technical specifications to deliver customized reporting systems. Accountable for end-to-end development and support of Polyaire’s BI reporting environments for ongoing metrics, reports, dashboards, etc. Creates data visualizations that illustrate data learnings and insights in an understandable and user-friendly manner through UI/UX design. Adopts and adapts to newly approved technologies, programming languages, tools, and standards for business intelligence. Collaborates to ensure application designs utilise appropriate patterns and standards. Creates and refines user manuals for each reporting application/visualisation. Documents BI application specifications and produces operational support manuals. Identifies and interprets trends, patterns, and correlations among various data points. Assesses functional and non-functional requirements and creates designs to meet both business and technical needs. Designs, builds, and maintains automated reporting, dashboards, and analysis to enable teams to self-service data needs. Assists in defining technical requirements such as tool or platform selection criteria for the reporting environments. Assists in solution design efforts (i.e., analysis, data warehouse design, architecture) and understands the data warehouse or data lakes implementation related to BI. Identifies, designs, and implements internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing BI capabilities. Identifies ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality of data management required for building BI applications and reports. Communicates technical concepts to non-technical audiences both in written and verbal form. Engages with other business units and customer environments to extract, restructure, and cleanse data. Skills and Competencies 2+ years’ experience working with BI technologies and tools like Microsoft Power BI, Phocas, Tableau etc. 2+ years’ BI related experience using ETL, Data warehousing management, Data Mining, Report Designer, or development; ability to write complex SQL queries against a variety of data sources. 3+ years’ heterogeneous database management systems experience for example: MS SQL, MySQL etc. and working knowledge with various data sources like flat files (csv, delimited), Web API, XML. Proven ability to build consensus between teams with differing architecture and design viewpoints and perspectives. Good understanding of data and query optimization, query profiling, and query performance monitoring tools and techniques. Experience implementing solutions on multiple platforms. Must be self-motivated, responsible, conscientious, and detail oriented. Proven ability to follow priorities and timelines. Must have strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Able to work in a fast-paced agile development environment. Experience Highly desirables: Microsoft Power BI certifications. Epicor or similar ERP experience Experience delivering reporting design, visualizations, and solutions through agile software development methodologies. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Qualifications BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent software/services experience.
